      • buildObject

        @Nullable
public static <T> T buildObject(@Nonnull
                                          Class<T> type,
                                          @Nullable
                                          AbstractSpec spec)

        Build an object from a specification. On its own, this method does very little. It depends on support from objects in order to work.

        It operates as follows:

        1. Load the SpecHandlers using ServiceLoader.
        2. Query each spec handler, in turn, to try to find one that can build an object of type type from the spec.
        3. If no such handler is found, try to invoke a static fromSpec(AbstractSpec) method on type.
        4. If no such method is found, or it returns null, throw NoSpecHandlerFound.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to build.
        spec - The specification to use.
        T - The built object type.
        Returns:
        The built object. Will be null if and only if spec is null.
        Throws:
        NoSpecHandlerFound - if no spec handler or fromSpec method can be found.

      • buildObject

        @Nullable
public static <T> T buildObject(@Nonnull
                                          Class<T> type,
                                          @Nullable
                                          AbstractSpec spec,
                                          ClassLoader cl)

        Build an object from a specification. On its own, this method does very little. It depends on support from objects in order to work.

        It operates as follows:

        1. Load the SpecHandlers using ServiceLoader.
        2. Query each spec handler, in turn, to try to find one that can build an object of type type from the spec.
        3. If no such handler is found, try to invoke a static fromSpec(AbstractSpec) method on type.
        4. If no such method is found, or it returns null, throw NoSpecHandlerFound.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to build.
        spec - The specification to use.
        cl - The class loader to search.
        T - The built object type.
        Returns:
        The built object. Will be null if and only if spec is null.
        Throws:
        NoSpecHandlerFound - if no spec handler or fromSpec method can be found.

      • copySpec

        public static <T extends AbstractSpec> T copySpec(T spec)

        Make a copy of a spec. Rather than implementing the complicated Cloneable infrastructure, we just round-trip the spec through JSON and copy all specs easily.

        Parameters:
        spec - The spec to copy.
        T - The spec type.
        Returns:
        The copied spec.
